chunks.en: When is the right time to buy a house?

House prices have been falling for so long, but online discussions are all about how they will continue to fall for the next ten years or more. For those who work away from home and don't yet have their own house, seeing other people's discussions makes it feel like there will never be an opportunity to buy a house in this lifetime. What are your thoughts on when to buy a house in the future?

Don't listen to what netizens say. Go and see more houses yourself first, understand the house prices and planning in various areas, and then make plans. Do you really think netizens know a lot? ğŸ¶ https://v2ex.com/t/694263
In 2015, people thought house prices would rise forever.
In 2025, people think house prices will fall forever.
It is very likely that the people who say the above two things are the same group of people.
If you want to buy, now is the time.
If you don't want to buy, there's never a good time.
If it's for your own residence, buy when you need it. If it's for investment...
Do ordinary people still want to buy at the lowest point?
Don't dream about it. If you have this ability, choose a few stock low points to buy.
Let's wait and see.
In Chongqing, mortgage payments are now cheaper than rent in many places.
If you wait another year, the rent will be a real gift to the landlord.
Around 2027-2028
If you flip through these types of posts, you will know that most people here don't have a correct judgment, and those who have a correct judgment are mostly just lucky.
The replies from people here are not very useful for reference, otherwise no one would lose money in the stock market.

Actually, it hasn't fallen for long, but this place emphasizes speed.

chunks.en: It's only been a few years, and marriage, childbirth, and birth rates have all collapsed. There are even old guys in the forum coming out to persuade people to have children. Can you believe it?
You can buy if you need it. Don't expect new houses to be cheap (the government is controlling them). You can bargain aggressively for used houses.
It is a buyer's market now.
Buy when you need it, and don't look at the price after buying.
Many houses with loans are now negative assets, and they will only become cheaper in the future. You can bargain aggressively.
When you have enough money on hand, it doesn't feel like the right time to empty six wallets, after all, the unemployment rate and employment rate are there.
The prices of good used and new houses are like this now.
You can bargain for used houses that are about 10 years old.
It's already very low now, and it's almost back to the level of 2016/17.
No one can eat from the head to the tail of the fish (catch the absolute bottom/top).
It's just empty talk if you don't say where. Shanghai's continuous hot transactions mean that many buyers think the price is right.
For me, in Shanghai, when the house age is less than 20 years and the rent-to-sale ratio is less than 500.
It is estimated that it will fall to the price of 2014-15, now is not the best time.
